com.itko.lisa.test

Interface DataSet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NamedType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataSetImpl

    public interface DataSet
extends NamedType
    This interface is the RMI-enabled server contract for all DataSets. A data set is a class that provides some kind of property setting features from a collection (it is presumed but not implicitly required).

    Conceptually, a file, result set from a database, or some other type of record list contains columns and rows. The column titles make good property keys, and each row has a value for that property key.

    It is expected that DataSets must be RMI servers, although not required to be named and located as such, because they are by nature likely to serve all test clients from a single location (file, table of rows, etc.) The likelihood is that you will want each record read in one logical sequence by all test clients.

    These data sets that are RMI servers are constructed wherever the TestCase is constructed, which would be in the Coordinator if you are doing things the old fashioned way.

    Please see DataSetImpl for details on the reference implementation of this interface (it's an abstract class), and the methods here for a decription of the intended behaviour of this interface.

    See Also:
    DataSetImpl

    • Method Detail

      • baseInit

        void baseInit(org.w3c.dom.Element dataset)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                     TestDefException
        This method is called to setup the properties of every data set. It is implemented by DataSetImpl since it should be common to every use. This method will call down into the initialize() method of the data set to do any polymorphic initialization that is needed.
        Parameters:
        dataset - - this is the DOM object for the data set
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException
        See Also:
        initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element,java.util.Map)

      • initialize

        void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element dataset,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> tcProps)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       TestDefException
        Called during test case construction to read the XML document data that is specific to this kind of data set. The built-in DataSetImpl does NOT implement this method but instead makes it an abstract method. The specific data set class referenced in the type attribute is instantiated, and it's implementation of this method is called.
        Parameters:
        dataset - - this is the DOM object for the data set
        tcProps -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException

      • initialize

        void initialize(ParameterList params,
              TestExec ts)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       TestDefException
        This is an alternative to getting one of these made by building a ParameterList instead of giving us an XML Element. What will happen is that you'll call getParameters(), fill that out, then call initialize() to make the DataSet know what it needs to know, you're then ready to execute methods on it live!
        Parameters:
        params - parameters to use
        ts - TestExec used for parsing in props
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException

      • getRecord

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> getRecord(java.util.Map<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> testState)
                                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                   TestRunException
        This is the method called by the TestNode class in order to do a logical read on the data set so that the specific property settings of this data set record are reflected in the caller's state. Note that the use of the word record is not literal.
        Returns:
        if all is well, a Map of the state to be added to the current test case state. If this method returns null, then you are to divert the execution of the test to this data set's at end (getAtEnd())
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called for the obvious purpose of getting the name of this data set. Must be unqiue within the test case in which it is defined
        Returns:
        the name of the data set
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sets the name for this data set. Data sets are referenced by their name, so you need to make sure this name is the one used in the test case by nodes that want to read data from this data set.
        Parameters:
        name - new name of the data set
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAtend

        java.lang.String getAtend()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        The AtEnd is the node that should be executed when their are no more rows in the result set of this data set.
        Returns:
        the String name of the node that is executed instead of the
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        for an explanation of AtEnd

      • setAtend

        void setAtend(java.lang.String atend)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sets the AtEnd attribute for this data set. Must be either null or a valid node reference. A valid node reference can contain property parsing logic.
        Parameters:
        atend - the node name or null
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • destroy

        void destroy()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by the framework to give you a chance to clean up after youself, like close your DB connection!
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        If a data set is local then it is instanced for every test exec individually, not as a "globally-scoped" object
        Returns:
        am I local?
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getParameters

        ParameterList getParameters()
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        For any DataSet, this method will return all the attributes of that object Basically, every non-transient type state value (name, type, atend) and whatever custom properties there are (like location and delimiter)
        Returns:
        the set of ParameterList that hold the attributes for this data set
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • reset

        void reset()
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by the framework when a property name "lisa." + getName() + ".reset" is set == true The dataset should "reset" itself to its initial state and begin reading from the beginning. The framework will take care of setting the value of the reset property to false after this method is called
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • cancelProcessing

        void cancelProcessing()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by the DataSetBaseInfoEditor to cancel current processing. Respective DataSet is reponsible to perform whatever operation is required.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns:
        true if processing is canceled otherwise return false.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • validateData

        void validateData(java.util.Map<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> testState)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         TestRunException
        Called by the DataSetBaseInfoEditor to perform validation. What need to be validated is depend on the respective DataSet type.
        Parameters:
        testState -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException

      • writeXML

        void writeXML(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        We write XML just like the next guy, but because we are a Remote object we can't do it w/o having to throw RemoteException from the Interface, so we just happen to have the same method
        Parameters:
        pw - stream
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getType

        java.lang.String getType()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the classname of the class implementing this interface. We cannot rely on obj.getClass().getName() for the classname because, if obj is an RMI handle, then obj.getClass().getName() returns something like , which offers no help in determining the ControllerBase that pairs with this DataSet.
        Returns:
        the classname of the dataset implementation
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
